messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] Sandra / humor
messages.msgSnippet: ... ROFL!  I didn t when I first read it, but I can now. Tia They that can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither
messages.messageBody:
> **She's a trial and a
> peach, a pebble in one's shoe and a stalwart defender of the meaning
> of unschooling. She has a sharp way with words and can paint ideas
> and possibilities you never knew existed. She's a living
> contradiction and a strong steady influence - and we're all better
> off for having known her.**
>
> Did anyone but me hear a whole chorus of singing nuns when reading this
> part? <g>

ROFL! I didn't when I first read it, but I can now.
Tia

"They that can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety
deserve neither liberty nor safety." Ben Franklin
leschke@...

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] Sandra / humor
messages.msgSnippet: **She s a trial and a peach, a pebble in one s shoe and a stalwart defender of the meaning of unschooling. She has a sharp way with words and can paint ideas
messages.messageBody:
**She's a trial and a
peach, a pebble in one's shoe and a stalwart defender of the meaning
of unschooling. She has a sharp way with words and can paint ideas
and possibilities you never knew existed. She's a living
contradiction and a strong steady influence - and we're all better
off for having known her.**

Did anyone but me hear a whole chorus of singing nuns when reading this
part? <g>

Betsy
